item.title: Print of the day - paint stirrer
Prometheus on Nixos
item.description: Great guide to setting up monitoring on your nixos install

item.title: Wiggle
item.description: Have a pesky patch that is only partially correct, and generates some .rej files. Use wiggle to apply the remaining changes in a safe fashion. How did I not know this before?

item.title: journald logs since last service restart.
item.description: While debugging services I often want to see the systemd service log since last restart. Unfortunately doing this isn’t obvious, but there is a way. $ journalctl _SYSTEMD_INVOCATION_ID=$(systemctl show --value -p InvocationID docker-hass) where docker-hass is your service. I should probably add an alias for this to my dotfiles.

item.title: Queen's Gambit
item.description: We’ve been watching this show on Netflix every evening since it came out on friday, best mini series I’ve seen in years.

item.title: Remelting thermoplastics in salt
item.description: Very interesting method to increase the strength of 3D printed parts. The salt ensures the object retains its shape and can be washed away after the baking.

item.title: Deadpool
item.description: Been on a 3d model painting kick lately. This one is a work in progress but I think it’s starting to shape up. love how you can layer paint for continous improvement

item.title: Pair programming
item.description: This graph is a good visualization of why I believe in pair programming. Pair programming contributes to higher internal software quality. It can seem like a slow down at first, but you'll forget about that with the medium- and long-term impacts to the codebase and the product. pic.twitter.com/nEk5e7BsUz — üî• Josh Branchaud üëª (@jbrancha) August 31, 2020 To me this has always seemed intuitively right. Unfortunate that so many developers seem hesitant to participate in pair programming.

item.title: Free Cnc project files.
item.description: Some nice cnc projects, should give these a try.

item.title: Sandman The Audio Book
item.description: Just finished this, and it was glorious. Great voice acting, and I could almost see the comic strips from so long ago in my mind while reading. Weither you have good memories of the graphics novel, or you have ignored it because “comics aren’t real books”, I warmly recommended checking out this epic version of the story of the endless.

item.title: httpstat - great curl visualization
item.description: Great little tool for seeing http timing stats. TIL, httpstat: visualizes curl(1) statistics in a way of beauty and clarity -- nifty and instant replacement for my own curl timing script... GitHub: https://t.co/L1jpopqyyq pic.twitter.com/eNzCQQzDoW — Ilya Grigorik (@igrigorik) August 12, 2020

item.title: More praise for magit
item.description: I know I’ve mentioned magit before here, but I think this post shows a lot of the power you get from magit, which now makes it preferable to me even over the CLI.
